title: Slide 04: The New Frontier - From Coders to Architects

dialogue.speaker: Dev A
dialogue.line: So beyond the stats and speed, what does this actually mean for us as developers day-to-day?
dialogue.emotion: genuinely curious, leaning forward, professionally engaged

dialogue.speaker: Dev B
dialogue.line: That's the best part! We get to be architects instead of keyboard monkeys. All that boilerplate code, repetitive patterns, documentation...AI handles it.

dialogue.speaker: Dev A
dialogue.line: Architects? That sounds a bit grandiose. We still need to understand the code, right?

dialogue.speaker: Dev B
dialogue.line: Of course! But instead of spending 80% of our time writing boilerplate and 20% solving interesting problems, it flips. We focus on the creative, complex challenges.

dialogue.speaker: Dev A
dialogue.line: Wait, so we're not getting replaced? I keep hearing about how AI is coming for everyone's jobs...

dialogue.speaker: Dev B
dialogue.line: Quite the opposite! Our jobs get way more interesting. We become product-focused problem solvers who happen to use code as our medium.

dialogue.speaker: Dev A
dialogue.line: So you're saying instead of wrestling with TypeScript errors, we could be designing better simulation experiences for Regis customers?

dialogue.speaker: Dev B
dialogue.line: Exactly! Think about those complex simulations we build. AI lets us iterate on the experience and logic instead of getting bogged down in implementation details.
dialogue.emotion: excitedly confirming, gesturing toward imaginary screen

dialogue.speaker: Dev A
dialogue.line: But why now? I mean, these tools have been around for a bit already...

dialogue.speaker: Dev B
dialogue.line: Because we're at the tipping point! The latest models actually understand context, can debug their own mistakes, and have enough knowledge to be truly useful collaborators.

dialogue.speaker: Dev A
dialogue.line: And you really think this will help deliver more value to Regis customers faster?

dialogue.speaker: Dev B
dialogue.line: Without a doubt. Imagine bringing every product idea to life in half the time. Those simulation concepts we've had on the backlog for months? We could actually build them now.

dialogue.speaker: Dev A
dialogue.line: I have to admit, being able to focus on the challenging parts of our simulations rather than fighting with MobX state management sounds pretty appealing.

dialogue.speaker: Dev B
dialogue.line: And that's just development. It streamlines everythingâ€”planning, testing, documentation. The whole process gets this productivity boost.

dialogue.speaker: Dev A
dialogue.line: So it's kind of like... we're finally getting to be the developers we always wanted to be when we started coding?

dialogue.speaker: Dev B
dialogue.line: You nailed it. It's like having a junior dev who works at superhuman speed, never complains, and lets us focus on the architectural and creative challenges we love.
dialogue.emotion: warmly affirming, genuinely excited about future
